name: Black Lentil Stew with Sausage and Kale
author: Chef John
summary: There's nothing like a big, steaming bowl of comfort food to make everything seem all right, and this dark but delightful black lentil stew with sausage and kale is no exception. Sausage and lentils is a marriage made in heaven, and so good together, that not even kale can ruin it. I'm kidding, and actually love kale, but if you're not the biggest fan in the world, maybe try it one more time in this.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) ring smoked garlic sausage, sliced
1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste
freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Melt butter in a pot over medium heat
Saute onion, carrot, and celery until starting to soften, about 5 minutes
Stir in bay leaf and lentils
Pour in broth; season with salt and pepper
Increase heat and bring soup to a simmer
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until lentils start to swell up, about 20 minutes
In the meantime, pull kale leaves away from the stem
Roll leaves up and chop into ribbons
Place in a colander and wash
Stir kale and tomato into the soup
Cook until kale and lentils are tender, 20 to 25 minutes
Ladle soup into serving bowls and garnish with sour cream and cayenne pepper
